encyclopedia.content: 同步。是一个将两个信号输出系统（如硬盘录音机和一个MIDI音序器或录像机）进行锁定并进行等位播放的过程。在触发同步方式下，录音机在接收到一个规定的触发信号后即开始播放。开始播放后，放音速度则由录音机内部的时钟进行控制而不受外部触发信号速度的控制。另外一些功能更为强大的同步方式则可以利用同步信号控制播放的快慢。

entry.tran: (使)同步;(使)在时间上一致;(使)同速进行
entry.def: If you synchronize two activities, processes, or movements, or if you synchronize one activity, process, or movement with another, you cause them to happen at the same time and speed as each other.

example.ex: It was virtually impossible to synchronise our lives so as to take holidays and weekends together...
example.tran: 想让我们的生活步调保持一致好一起去度假和过周末几乎是不可能的事。

example.ex: Synchronise the score with the film action.
example.tran: 将配乐和电影情节进行同步合成。

means.word_mean: 1. the relation that exists when things occur at the same time;

sentences.sentence: "the drug produces an increased synchrony of the brain waves"

means.word_mean: 2. an adjustment that causes something to occur or recur in unison
3. coordinating by causing to indicate the same time;

sentences.sentence: "the synchronization of their watches was an important preliminary"
